resources.string: The Forest Culture Center (OKL) in Gołuchów operates within the structure of the State Forests National Forest Holding. It was established as an independent organizational unit in December 1986, but the first steps towards its creation were made in the 1970s, when the decision was made to locate the Forestry Museum in the 19th-century castle and park complex in Gołuchów The concept of establishing a forestry museum appeared during one of the first meetings of the Galician Forest Society (later the Polish Forest Society) at the end of the 19th century. The need to create this type of museum was announced in the form of an appeal in 1894 during the General National Exhibition in Lviv, where the achievements of Polish foresters were presented. The content of the appeal was repeated many times during various conventions, conferences and other such exhibitions.
Select image and press predict button.
Go to the right place to get a point.

Bisons. The bison is the largest land mammal in Europe. In Poland, it lives in herds in the wild and in closed farms. It is under species protection. Bisons were brought to Gołuchów in 1977. The Gołuchów herd was started by: the bull Plantor and the cow Polira from the Bison Breeding Center in Smardzewice and the cows Ponta and Polana from the Bison Breeding Center in Pszczyna. In total, 88 bison were bred in the Show Animal Farm by the end of 2009, 76 of them were born in Gołuchów. Organization of the homestead and the separation of the so-called day pens allow you to watch the animals from dawn to dusk all year round.

Polish ponies. In 2004, Polish ponies were brought from the Roztocze National Park. Polish ponies come from forest tarpans, small mammals of the equine family, a mouse coat with a dark stripe running along the back, a black tail and a black mane. Calm and gentle Polish ponies are a species with low breeding requirements.

Boars have lived in Zaguchów Zagroda since 2004. They were brought from the Research Station of the Polish Hunting Association in Czempiń. The wild boar inhabits all types of forests. It is omnivorous. Its delicacies include acorns and crops such as potatoes and corn. An adult individual reaches 80 cm in height and a body length of 150 cm. It is a game species.

Fallow deer. The first specimens were brought to Gołuchów in 1997. Back then, they were white fallow deer from the Zoo in Wrocław, currently in the farm you can admire fallow deer with a typical forest coloration, donated from the Podanin Forest District. Daniel was brought to Poland in the 17th century. Currently, it performs almost all over the country. It is a game species. It moves in a characteristic way: galloping, jumping, bouncing with four legs at the same time.
Parking is free and open from sunrise to sunset.
Select a photo to then take a photo of the object to get a point

If you want to use this functionality of the application, go to the settings and grant the application permission to use the camera.
Great job, the point is added!

The appliation was created as part of Rafał Stefaniak engineering work. Android 6.0 is required for proper functioning. \ nPhotos and information contained in the application come from the website of the Forest Culture Center in Gołuchów https://www.okl.lasy.gov.pl and from the author himself. The Forest Culture Center has agreed to provide the author with content from the website for non-commercial purposes. Links to images used in the application, which the author did not make personally, can be found in the written work. If you have any questions about the application or there are any bugs, please contact us at rafi13.rs@gmail.com
